Package com.github.mmichaelis.hamcrest.nextdeed.concurrent

Matcher for concurrent changes of the system/component under test.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ProbeAssert<T,R>
    Runs matchers on the result of given functions and throws AssertionError on failure.
    ProbeAssume<T,R>
    Runs matchers on the result of given functions and throws AssumptionViolatedException on failure.
    ProbeBuilder<T,R>
    Builder for Probes.
    ProbeRequire<T,R>
    Runs matchers on the result of given functions and throws WaitTimeoutException on failure.
    WaitBuilder
    Interface for any wait-related builders.
    WaitFunctionBuilder<T,R>
    A builder for WaitFunctions.
    WaitTimeoutEvent<T,R>
    Event when a WaitFunction times out.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Probe
    Utility class for launching probes on a system.
    WaitFunction<T,R>
    A function that waits before returning its result until a given predicate is met.
    WaitTimeoutEventImpl<T,R>
    Implementation of event when a WaitFunction times out.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    WaitTimeoutException
    Exception thrown when a wait operation times out.

Package com.github.mmichaelis.hamcrest.nextdeed.concurrent Description

Matcher for concurrent changes of the system/component under test.

Example:
 Deque<String> strings = new ArrayDeque<>(Arrays.asList("Lorem", "Ipsum"));
 Probe.<Deque<String>, String>probing(strings)
      .withinMs(1L)
      .assertThat(
                  new Function<Deque<String>, String>() {
                    &#64;Override
                    public String apply(Deque<String> input) {
                      return input.pop().toLowerCase();
                    }
                  },
                  Matchers.equalTo("ipsum")
      );

While this example is somewhat academic you still might get the meaning. While the test above triggers the state change, a typical system of course changes its state over time.

Since:
0.1.0
